info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:44AM MDT until June 23 at 2:15AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL...NORTHWESTERN HARDING...EAST CENTRAL MORA AND SOUTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES... At 144 AM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles west of Solano, or 13 miles west of Mosquero, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Roy, Mills, Chicosa Lake State Park and Solano. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
